com.smartcar.sdk

Class AuthClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.smartcar.sdk.AuthClient

  • public class AuthClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Smartcar OAuth 2.0 Authentication Client

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AuthClient.AuthUrlBuilder
      A builder for creating Authorization URLs.
      static class  AuthClient.AuthVehicleInfo
      Deprecated. 
      as of 2.1.0. Please use AuthClient.AuthUrlBuilder instead. A class that creates a custom AuthVehicleInfo object, which can be used when generating an authentication URL.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AuthClient

        public AuthClient(java.lang.String clientId,
                  java.lang.String clientSecret,
                  java.lang.String redirectUri,
                  java.lang.String[] scope,
                  boolean testMode)
        Initializes a new AuthClient.
        Parameters:
        clientId - the application client ID
        clientSecret - the application client secret
        redirectUri - the registered redirect URI for the application
        scope - the permission scope requested
        testMode - launch the Smartcar auth flow in test mode

        public AuthClient(java.lang.String clientId,
                  java.lang.String clientSecret,
                  java.lang.String redirectUri)
        Initializes a new AuthClient.
        Parameters:
        clientId - the client ID to be used with all requests
        clientSecret - the client secret to be used with all requests
        redirectUri - the configured redirect URL associated with the account

      • getAuthUrl

        @Deprecated
public java.lang.String getAuthUrl(java.lang.String state,
                                               boolean forcePrompt,
                                               AuthClient.AuthVehicleInfo authVehicleInfo)
        Deprecated. as of 2.1.0. Please use AuthClient.AuthUrlBuilder. Returns the assembled authentication URL.
        Parameters:
        state - an arbitrary string to be returned to the redirect URI
        forcePrompt - whether to force the approval prompt to show every auth
        authVehicleInfo - an optional AuthVehicleInfo object. Including the make property causes the car brand selection screen to be bypassed.
        Returns:
        the authentication URL

      • getAuthUrl

        @Deprecated
public java.lang.String getAuthUrl(java.lang.String state)
        Deprecated. as of 2.1.0. Please use AuthClient.AuthUrlBuilder. Returns the assembled authentication URL.
        Parameters:
        state - an arbitrary string to be returned to the redirect URI
        Returns:
        the authentication URL

        the requested access token
        Throws:

      • exchangeRefreshToken

                          throws SmartcarException

        Parameters:
        refreshToken - the refresh token
        Returns:
        the requested access token
        Throws:
        SmartcarException - when the request is unsuccessful

      • isCompatible

        public boolean isCompatible(java.lang.String vin,
                            java.lang.String[] scope)
                     throws SmartcarException
        Determine if a vehicle is compatible with the Smartcar API and the provided permissions. A compatible vehicle is a vehicle that:
        1. has the hardware required for internet connectivity,
        2. belongs to the makes and models Smartcar supports, and
        3. supports the permissions.
        Parameters:
        vin - the VIN (Vehicle Identification Number) of the vehicle.
        scope - An array of permissions. The valid permissions are found in the API Reference.
        Returns:
        false if the vehicle is not compatible. true if the vehicle is likely compatible.
        Throws:
        SmartcarException - when the request is unsuccessful

      • isCompatible

        public boolean isCompatible(java.lang.String vin,
                            java.lang.String[] scope,
                            java.lang.String country)
                     throws SmartcarException
        Determine if a vehicle is compatible with the Smartcar API and the provided permissions for the specified country. A compatible vehicle is a vehicle that:
        1. has the hardware required for internet connectivity,
        2. belongs to the makes and models Smartcar supports, and
        3. supports the permissions.
        Parameters:
        vin - the VIN (Vehicle Identification Number) of the vehicle.
        scope - An array of permissions. The valid permissions are found in the API Reference.
        country - An optional country code according to [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)
        Returns:
        false if the vehicle is not compatible in the specified country. true if the vehicle is likely compatible.
        Throws:
        SmartcarException - when the request is unsuccessful

      • setApiVersion

        public void setApiVersion(java.lang.String version)
        Sets the API version
        Parameters:
        version - API version to set

      • execute

        protected static okhttp3.Response execute(okhttp3.Request request)
                                   throws SmartcarException
        Sends the specified request, returning the raw response body.
        Parameters:
        request - the desired request to transmit
        Returns:
        the response body
        Throws:
        SmartcarException - if the request is unsuccessful

      • execute

        protected static <T extends ApiData> SmartcarResponse<T> execute(okhttp3.Request request,
                                                                 java.lang.Class<T> dataType)
                                                          throws SmartcarException
        Sends the specified request, parsing the response into the specified type. Wraps the request with the unitSystem and age meta data.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the data container for the parsed response JSON
        Parameters:
        request - the desired request to transmit
        dataType - the type into which the response will be parsed
        Returns:
        the wrapped response
        Throws:
        SmartcarException - if the request is unsuccessful
